title: Nintendo Dispatch
description: Join Christina, James, and Michael each week as they breakdown the latest news, game releases, and happenings in the Nintendo universe. No topic or game system is off limits as we discuss at the Nintendo Switch, 3DS, Nintendo's mobile games, theme parks, merchandise, and whatever else awesome Nintendo is doing. Join us each week for a new episode of awesome. Now you're playing with power!

_fireside.subtitle: The latest news, game releases, and happenings in the Nintendo universe, released every Wednesday.

items.summary: This week we have MORE Pokemon news for you including the record-breaking sales numbers. We also discuss what we would like to see in the NEXT Pokemon game. We discuss Mega Man coming to Dragalia Lost, Nintendo Merch on Amazon, Animal Crossing getting two subscription plans, a cute new Eevee Funko Pop announcement, and all the games coming out this week that we feel are worth playing!

items.title: 82: Pokémon, Pokémon, Pokémon, & Ring Fit Adventure
items.content_text:
The Nintendo Switch is the best-selling console and Luigi's Mansion is smashing records, but Pokémon Sword & Shield are here so it is time for tons of Pokémon! We break down the latest news and drama behind these releases along with tons of game news. We also do a full hands on for Ring Fit Adventure that James has finally been trying out, and is really impressed. Finally, we have the game releases for the week including Zumba, Touryst, Still There, and Narcos.

items.title: 77: Brain Training, Motion Controlled Pokémon, Wargroove DLC, & ALL OF THE GAMES
items.content_text:
It is an EPIC week here at the Dispatch. Not only did we get Fortnite Chapter 2, but we also got tons of new Pokémon news and accessories, Super Mario World is real, a new Switch Pro controller, and plenty of Overwatch PR blunders. We have all the games including reviews of Puzzle Book, Shipped, Niffelheim, and lots of play time on My Time on Portia, Hyperforma, and Untitled Goose Game.

Oh, and we have ALL THE GAMES this week including Witcher 3, Zombieland, Overwatch, Little Town Hero, Sea Salt, Where the Bees Make Honey, and Ring Fit Adventure!

items.title: 76: MKT's Rocket Start & Review, Reggie's Induction, Sword and Shield Details, and Doom is Delayed
items.content_text:
Everyone is back for an epic special long edition of the dispatch. We have a lot to discuss with Mario Kart Tour, but first plenty of Pokemon news including mobile, accessories, and Sword/Shield. We also have all the latest games for the week including Trine, Valfaris, BDSM, and Killer Queen Black. Finally, we break down some games we have been playing including Pokemon Let's Go, Puzzel Quest, Gems of War, My Time at Portia, Link's Awakening, and more!

items.title: 74: Reviews Are In - Switch Lite, Untitled Goose Game, Link's Awakening, & Niffelheim

We have some new news on Luigi's Mansion 3, Pokemon Go, Ori & the Blind Forest, and Bloodstained. All of this with our full reviews of Niffelheim and Untitled Goose Game! Christina and James go hands-on with the "buddy mode" in Wolfeinstein: Younblood, play way too much Mario Kart, give updates on My Time in Portia, and try out the Nintendo Switch voice chat app! There is also huge new with Nintendo offering up joy-con repairs for free, Doom hits the Switch with DRM, and we are reminded who really makes Pokemon.

items.title: 38: Fortnite Supply Drop, 2019 Switch Games, NES Classic Anger, Smash Bros. Success
items.content_text:

We also examine the new laws in Japan making it illegal to mod consoles, release dates for Yoshi, Kirby, and Dragon's Dogma. We discuss the good side of NES classic games on the Switch Online and at the same time address the anger from gamers. We finish it all of with the new releases and a special segment where we cover our top game and accessory picks of 2018.

items.title: 13: Octopath Sells Tons, MHGU x Zelda, Labo Creator Contest, and Super Destronaut DX War!
items.content_text:
The Nintendo Switch is completely crushing it in Japan as Octopath Traveler has taken the world by storm! Nintendo also announced some amazing new Zelda crossovers with both Mario Kart 8 and the new Monster Hunter Generations Ultimate. We try to figure out why Dillon's Dead-Heat Breakers didn't sell many copies and what a Tingle game would have been. Several other news stories including Unreal Engine updates, Labo Creator's Winners, and Nintendo buying tons of television commercials.

All of this while we break down the new releases including Mega Man X Legacy Collection, Go Vacation, Hello Neighbor, Semblance, Element, Sleep Tight and more. We of course chat games and get real in-depth with our new favorite game Super Destronaut DX!

items.title: 12: Splatoon Hackers, Let's Go Reveals, Rocket League Cross-Play, and Fortnite Season 5
items.content_text:
Splatoon 2 players are getting upset about rampant cheating happening in online battles and calling for anti-cheat measures to be put in place. Nintendo is actively fighting it by banning consoles and rolling out hardware updates to patch exploits. Nintendo unleashed a new Pokemon Let's Go trailer with tons of goodies, Panic Button has "tons" in store for the Switch, Cross-play comes to Rocket League, and we diagnose if Mario Tennis Aces truely is broken.

We of course of the latest releases including Galak-Z: Variant S, Adventure Time, Sonic Mania Plus, Mugsters, Pool Panic, and so much more.

items.title: 11: Favorite Zelda Game, All the Pokémon, New Splatfest, Warframe, and Semblance
items.content_text:
This week is filled with all things Pokémon as Go celebrates two full years out on the app store and Quest is crushing it in the first week. Reggie also sits down to discuss his favorite Zelda game and so do we! In other news Splatoon's next Splatfest is a total civil war, Nintendo releases some amazing new 2DS designs, and we try to figure out how Wolfenstein 2 fits on to the Nintendo Switch.

As always we have the latest and greatest releases for Nintendo Switch and Nintendo 3DS including: Another World, 20XX, Pato Box, Bomber Crew, Super Destronaut DX, Octopath Traveler, and Captain Toad! Tune in for this and so much more!

items.title: 10: Mario Kart Labo, Future of the 3DS, Labo Creators Contest, & Arena of Valor
items.content_text:
Nintendo Labo is back and is everywhere as Mario Kart 8 gains official Labo support and Motz goes hands-on with the new "experience". Nintendo is also kicking off an awesome Labo Creators Contest with one of the coolest prizes that we have ever seen. There are tons of great interviews with Nintendo's Reggie Fils-Aimé &  Shuntaro Furukawa where they discuss the future of the 3DS and a Game Pass experience. Also, there is Todd Howard from Bethesda who touches on the success of Bethesda on the Switch and their future plans.  Motz and Michael dive into the Arena of Valor private beta and give their full thoughts after several hours of playing. 

Michael gives his impressions of Captain Toad Treasure Tracker and Motz goes deep into Mario Tennis Aces and Thumper!

We have all of the latest game news including Fortnite's rocket launch, Splatoon 2 updates, Hollow Knight success, and even some new accessories such as the Ultimate Gaming Grip and the Legend of Zelda Encyclopedia. We wrap it all up by taking a look at the new releases this week: Awkward, Miles & Kiloa, Mushroom Wars 2, Pocket Rumble, Two Crude Dudes, and a lot more.

items.title: 9: Flip Grip Backed, Cross-Play for Everyone, Donkey Kong Adventure, & Pokémon Go Gifts
items.content_text:
In this week's episode we discuss cross-play a bit more and the recent ad showcasing Nintendo and Microsoft gamers playing Minecraft together. We also get into the numbers a bit by breaking down the May NPD's. We discuss Wolfenstein and their plans (or no plans) on the Switch. We also talk about the new Flip Grip by Fangamer. 

In addition to all the news, we also break down all the new games coming out this week including: Lumines Remastered, De Blob, Mario+Rabbids Donkey Kong Adventure DLC, Ys VIII: Lacrimosa of DANA, LIMBO, INSIDE, Figment, Crash Bandicoot N Sane Trilogy, and Wolfeinstein II: The New Colossus.

items.title: 8: Splatoon 2 Octo Expansion, Octopath Traveler, Fortnite Mysteries & Cross-Play Updates
items.content_text:
Yes, Sony hates gamers and continues to block Fortnite cross-play and Nintendo has an official statement. Pokémon Go gets a huge update and Nintendo sneaks out some great new games including Octo Expansion for Splatoon 2 and Donkey Kong on Switch! 

Reggie has an amazing interview where he discusses Nintendo Switch sales, Fortnite on Switch and Cross-Play, continuing 2DS/3DS support, and how mobile impacts Nintendo and future games. items.title: 6: Pokémon News, Fortnite on Switch, and Mario Tennis Aces
items.content_text:
This week we recap ALL that crazy Pokémon news, as well as Niantic paying out $1,575,000 because the first PokémonGo fest was such a failure. We also talk E3 leaks and rumors, Fortnite on the Switch, the new Astro gaming headset, and the top games of last week on the eShop!

As always, we also break down all the new games releasing this week including Happy Birthdays, The Infectious Madness of Doctor Dekker, Shape of the World, A Magical High School Girl, NEOGEO RIDING HERO, Banner Saga 2, Games for Toddlers 2, GRIDD: Retroenhanced, Iro Hero, KADOBAT WARS, Samurai Defender: Ninja Warfare, Storm Chaser - Tornado Alley, and Sushi Striker: The Way of Sushido 

Lastly, we discuss what we've been playing this week including, Ikaruga, Bloodstained: Curse of the Moon, Pokemon Quest, Mario Tennis Aces, and Battle Chasers! 

It's another great episode! Enjoy!

items.title: Bonus Round: Pokémon Announcements & Nintendo E3 Predictions
items.content_text:
It is finally time for our Nintendo E3 Predictions! We break down each and every crazy thing that Nintendo could do in a few weeks during their Direct, but of course they had to go and spoil it by announcing two new Pokémon games right after we recorded, so we put in a little bonus for you!

Before we go into our predictions (which we actually recorded before the Pokémon announcements) we talk about all the awesome stuff that The Pokémon Company and Nintendo announced including Pokémon Quest, Pokémon: Let's Go, and Pokémon 2019. items.title: 3: Launch Contest, Nintendo Switch Online, Splatfest, Monster Hunter, Minecraft, & Bloodstained
items.content_text:
We are very excited to launch Nintendo Dispatch to the world and to kick things off right we're having an amazing contest with glorious prizes! Win a Waterfield Switch Cityslicker case or amazing Nintendo Switch games!

We discuss the new details recently released about Nintendo Switch Online. Cover game news on Monster Hunter Generations Ultimate and Minecraft Bedrock Edition as well as Bloodstained: Curse of the Moon. We also break down all the new games releasing this week including Battle Chasers: Nightwar, Wizard of Legend, Yonder The Cloud Catcher Chronicles, Fairune Collection, The Banner Saga, Hyrule Warriors: Definitive Edition, and Little Nightmares Complete Edition. 

Lastly, we go over what we're playing this week and chat about the recent Splatfest, Mikey vs Donnie!

items.title: 2: Miitomo is Dead, Nintendo Gets Sued, & Nintendo Going Mobile
items.content_text:
Nintendo has decided to shut down the Miitomo, Nintendo's first app. Nintendo is getting sued by Gamevice on the claim that the Switch design infringes on their patents. With the death of Miitomo and Nintendo creating a new IP for mobile, James and Michael discuss the future of mobile gaming for Nintendo.

We also break down our full review of Light Fall and the new PinballFX 3 updates and of course cover the new releases including Death Road to Canada, Immortal Redneck, Garage, Raging Justice, Suicide Guy, and more.

items.title: 1: Nintendo's New President, Switch Success, E3 Schedule, & Labo Constructed
items.content_text:
Big news in the Nintendo universe with the announcement that Tatsumi Kimishima will step down as president. A strong 2017 fiscal year thanks to the Switch's success. Nintendo looks to go big at this year's E3 with Super Smash Bros. and Splatoon. James start putting together cardboard with Nintendo Labo and picks up some of this week's releases including Light Fall.

Our topic this week is if Nintendo Switch needs a battle royale game? Fortnite coming to Switch? E3 and online service announcement? We discuss.
